items.prompt: Define the three types of conformity in social influence.
keyPoints: Compliance: conforming publicly but not privately
Identification: conforming to a role or group
Internalisation: conforming both publicly and privately

markingCriteria.full: Includes all three types with accurate definitions
markingCriteria.partial: Includes 1-2 types or lacks detail in definitions
markingCriteria.none: Missing types or provides inaccurate definitions

items.prompt: A student joins a new club and starts dressing like other members. Which type of conformity might this represent and why?
keyPoints: Identification: adopting behaviors to fit in with the group
Temporary change in behavior
Influence is stronger while being part of the group

markingCriteria.partial: Correctly identifies the type but lacks detailed reasoning

items.prompt: A person disagrees with a group privately but agrees publicly to avoid conflict. Which type of conformity does this represent?
keyPoints: Compliance: public agreement, private disagreement
Desire to avoid conflict

items.prompt: A person starts believing in environmental conservation after joining a group of activists. What type of conformity is this?
